P004682.project_name: Bangkok Water Supply And Sewerage Project

keywords.cdata: available water,available water supply,canals,channel,charges for water,chloride,competitive bidding,Construction,construction stage,cubic meter,cubic meters,Distribution Mains,distribution system,domestic water,domestic water use,drainage,flood protection,Groundwater,groundwater sources,imports,iron,joint venture,land use,leakage,Least Cost,liters per capita per day,liters per second,manufacturing industry,metering,metropolitan areas,municipal boundaries,municipal water,municipal water systems,municipalities,operators,pipe,pipe laying,pipeline,population growth,population growth rate,pressure,private water supply,private water supply systems,programs,Project Management,Provincial Water,Public Health,Public Utilities,public water,public water supply,public water supply system,Public water systems,pumping,Pumping Stations,quality water,rain,Raw Water,Reservoirs,rivers,rural communities,safe water,sale of water,Sanitary Engineering,service area,sewerage systems,shallow wells,Soils,squatters,storage capacity,storm water,supply of water,taps,urban areas,urban centers,urban communities,urban water,urban water systems,waste disposal,waste water,water demand,water distribution,water distribution system,water facilities,Water pollution,Water Production,water pumping,water pumping station,Water Rates,Water Requirements,water service,water sources,water storage,water supplies,Water Supply,water supply facilities,water supply service,Water Supply System,water supply systems,water system

project_abstract.cdata: The project consists of the following parts: (i) construction of raw water intake and transmission facilities, a new water treatment plant, treated water transmission tunnels, four distribution centers and new treated water storage reservoirs; (ii) purchase of equipment for transportation and general use in the Borrower's operations; (iii) provision of consulting services and training programs for the continued development and implementation of appropriate management, financial and operating practices of the Borrower; (iv) construction of approximately 188 kilometers of trunk mains; (v) construction of approximately 975 kilometers of distribution pipelines; (vi) improvement of the existing metering system, including the construction of a meter maintenance shop, overhauling of serviceable meters and the procurement and installation of approximately 158,000 new water meters; (vii) construction of approximately 50 groundwater wells; and (viii) engineering consultants' services for detailed design and construction supervision of Part B and for the Borrower's groundwater monitoring program and leakage control program.
